Apologise, I had mixed up the Employer page and Traineeship page.

Can we please make the changes to the Employer page (not sure if the URL can have the traineeship word removed)

https://mets.edu.au/employer-traineeship-guide/

Whether you are seeking to upskill your current workforce or train new employees, METS Training services is here to assist you

METS Training Services has proudly served small, medium, and large businesses, as well as government agencies, community, and not-for-profits organisation and enhancing workforce skills for over 30 years.

We specialise in building tailored relationships by listening carefully to employer needs. We recognise that every business is unique. We offer customised programs and flexible course delivery options designed to fit specific organisational requirements. We value diversity and welcome learners and employers from all cultural backgrounds.

The training approach at METS is to prioritise effective and comprehensive training and assessment services. Our team consists of highly qualified, experienced professionals who are passionate about delivering quality education. We maintain a Professional Development policy to ensure our VET professionals continually enhance their skills and knowledge, allowing them to adapt to the evolving needs of the sector. METS is committed to guiding both employees and employers by choosing the right training options and supporting both learner and employer throughout the training journey.

Whether you're looking for Traineeships, RPL (Recognition of Prior Learning) programs, Self-Paced Online courses, Short courses, or Skill Sets, METS has all your training needs covered.

We offer Comprehensive Training Solutions through:
- Consultation: We work closely with employers to identify training needs and tailor programs that align with organisational goals.
- Development: Our team collaborates with industry experts to create relevant and effective training materials and strategies.
- Delivery: We provide engaging and impactful training sessions that inspire learners and equip them with essential skills.
- Reporting: Our Learning Management System offers reporting capabilities, enabling easy access to track progress and generate reports as needed.

By Utalising innovative and creative training methods, our educators uphold the integrity of our qualifications, enabling both learners and employers to reach their education and business goals. The qualifications we offer are recognised nationwide, ensuring that our learners gain valuable credentials that are respected across industries.

https://mets.edu.au/employer-traineeship-guide/

Whether you are seeking to upskill your current workforce or train new employees, METS Training services is here to assist you

Enquire Now button - this takes you to the METS Prospectus page. This should take you to the Contact Us Page

https://mets.edu.au/employer-traineeship-guide/

New Heading: Learning options (Put under the Learning and delivery Options)

Insert



(New Heading) METS Learning options

Traineeships
A traineeship is on-the-job training with an employer, while you study and get paid. It is similar to an apprenticeship - where you work under a supervisor who will mentor and ensure you learn all the right skills.
It's perfect if you want to get a professional, industry-led qualification at the same time as real-world work experience.
At the end of your training, you will receive a nationally recognised qualification, a Certificate II, Certificate III or Diploma. A traineeship can run over one or two years and can be full-time or part-time.
There are a few options for trainees:

•A New Entrant Traineeship is available to anyone within the first 3 months of commencing full time employment with an employer. They may also qualify if they are within the first 12 months of a part-time employment arrangement or within 3 months of completing a pre-requisite qualification. Like any traineeship, your trainee will gain on the job experience whilst completing a qualification and will receive support and feedback throughout the duration of their studies.

•An Existing Worker Traineeship is great way to upskill and develop your workforce. Through structured on the job learning, your team will deepen and broaden their workplace skills and knowledge and get a nationally recognised qualification. An Existing Worker is an employee who has already been working for you for more than three months at full time equivalent. A 'full time equivalent' could be based on part time, casual or full time work; and approved leave is included in the time calculation. Like any traineeship, your employee will gain on the job experience whilst completing a qualification and will receive support and feedback from both you and METS throughout the duration of their studies. However, unlike New Entrant Traineeships, the NSW State Government does not fund Existing Worker Traineeships and therefore we must invoice the employer, to cover the training costs. In most cases, incentives an employer will receive from the Commonwealth Government will offset these costs.
*Eligibility Criteria applies to both funding and Traineeships. More information can be found here
https://education.nsw.gov.au/skills-nsw/apprentices-and-trainees/low-cost-and-free-training-options/smart-and-skilled

For more information, visit: https://mets.edu.au/ways-to-learn/traineeships/

•School Based Traineeships (SBAT) provide Learners the opportunity to complete a Nationally Recognised Vocational Education and Training (VET) Qualification while completing their Higher School Certificate (HSC). SBATs are available to all Year 10, 11 and 12 high school students in NSW and provide the opportunity to learn and earn. Learners are supported by their employer and RTO to be flexible with their HSC curriculum.
METS offer SBAT Traineeships for
• SIR20216 Certificate II in Retail Services
• SIR30216 Certificate III in Retail
• CHC30121 Certificate III in Early Childhood Education and Care

For more information, visit: https://mets.edu.au/school-based-apprenticeships-training/

Learners that are not eligible for Traineeships can enrol into the following training options;

RPL (Experience workers only)
Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL) is a process used to evaluate an individual's existing skills and knowledge to determine if they meet the criteria for a specific training course or qualification. This assessment can be based on formal, informal, or non-formal learning experiences. RPL allows individuals to leverage their past learning to gain qualifications more efficiently, saving both time and money.
Our RPL courses can be completed within 6 - 10 weeks ( hours can range from 2 - 4 hours per week dependant on qualification)
Our experienced RPL trainers work closely with learners and employers to ensure a streamlined and positive experience.

For more information, visit: https://mets.edu.au/ways-to-learn/recognition-of-prior-learning/

Self-Paced Learning
Self-Paced Learning is offered to *eligible Learners through a Fee for Service model who wish to complete the course within their own time.
They will have ongoing trainer support, without the additional requirements of a Traineeship. Depending on the industry/ qualification, trainers will still be required to complete observation tasks to deem the assessments competent
Smart and Skilled Government funding may be available. Contact the METS office for more information on 02 9838 0567

For more information, visit: https://mets.edu.au/smart-and-skilled/

Skill Sets
Skills sets are designed for anyone who are wanting to upskill but not complete a full qualification course. A skill set is a single unit of competency or combination of units of competency from one or more training packages that link to a licence or regulatory requirement, or defined industry need. This generally will take a short time frame to complete the course and can save money. The learner will receive a Statement of Attainment on completion, and can Credit Transfer the units to a Full qualification if they choose to further their education.

For more information, visit: Short Courses | METS Training Services

Hi Lana, 

I hope this email finds you well!

We’ve received your latest update request for the website. Just a quick check—proceeding with these changes will override the updates we made for you with the last update. Particularly with the https://mets.edu.au/employer-traineeship-guide page. Could you kindly confirm if you’re okay with that, or if there’s anything specific you’d like us to preserve?

Please let us know how you’d like us to proceed. We’re ready to make the updates as soon as we hear back from you!

Really appreciate it. I have seen some changes already

Just regarding the below request.

Course Area

Add additional boxes with other qualifications - Can we have an arrow to scroll through each Industry box and remove the View all courses button
Include
a. Change 'Children's Services' to ' Early Childhood Education and Care'
b. 'Diability - should only have CHC33021 and CHC43121. Remove CHC32015 Certificate III in Community Services
include to show HLTAID009 and HLTAID011
c.add a new tile for 'Ageing' -when you click on it, you will see a tile for CHC33021 Certificate III in Individual Support
d. add a new tile for 'Communit Services' -when you click on it, you will see a tile for CHC32015 Certificate III in Community Services
e. change 'Business & Management' tile to 'Business & Leadership'
f. add Retail Services - when you click on it, you will see a tile for SIR20216 Certificate II in Retail Services, SIR30216 Certificate III in Retail
g. add 'Hospitality' tile -when you click on it, you will see a tile for SIT20322 Certificate II in Hospitality
h. add Supply Chain Operaions tile -when you click on it, you will see a tile for TLI20421 Certificate II in Supply Chain Operations and TLI30321 Certificate III in Supply Chain Operations
i. Add 'Short Courses' tile - when you click on it, you will see a tile for - HLTAID009 Provide cardiopulmonary resuscitation and HLTAID011 Provide First Aid, HLTAID012 Provide First Aid in an education and care setting , CHCPRT025 Identify and report children and young people at risk

Can we have this changed as requested


  1. We want to have only 3 showing at a time, have an arrow for people to click on and scroll through the other Industry boxes

  2. We want the View all courses under these boxes to be removed

  3. They should all have different photos

Hi


Can we please have the 'Training with Us' page amended


Employers

Employer Traineeship Guide | METS Training Services


Heading

Change heading from 'Employer Traineeship Guide' to Employer Guide'

Employer Traineeship Guide | METS Training Services

Looking for a training provider for your business?

METS Training Services have been enhancing workforce skills for over 30 years. We specialise in building tailored relationships by listening carefully to employer needs. Recognising that every business is unique, we offer customised programs and flexible course delivery options designed to fit specific organisational requirements.

METS is committed to guiding both employees and employers by choosing the right training options and supporting you throughout the training journey. Our Learning Management System offers reporting capabilities, enabling easy access to track progress and generate reports as needed.
Whether you're looking for traineeships, RPL (Recognition of Prior Learning) programs, self-paced online courses, short courses, or skill sets, METS has all your training needs covered.

Employer Traineeship Guide | METS Training Services

Why Us

Its training with a difference

• Our trainers are industry experts and have extensive knowledge to support our learners throughout their training journey
•Flexible Training Options to suit employee and employer's needs
•keep up to date with your employee's progression and be provided with accessible reporting options
•Supportive Learning Management System
• Our trainers come to you, not the other way around! By training in the workspace environment, we save you unnecessary labour costs

Employer Traineeship Guide | METS Training Services

What is a traineeship?


delete this section

Employer Traineeship Guide | METS Training Services

What is a traineeship?


Replace 'What is a Traineeship' heading with 'Training Options' as the heading


Traineeships
A traineeship is on-the-job training with an employer, while you study and get paid. It is similar to an apprenticeship - where you work under a supervisor who will mentor and ensure you learn all the right skills.
It's perfect if you want to get a professional, industry-led qualification at the same time as real-world work experience.
At the end of your training, you will receive a nationally recognised qualification, a Certificate II, Certificate III or Diploma. A traineeship can run over one or two years and can be full-time or part-time.
There are a few options for trainees:

•A New Entrant Traineeship is available to anyone within the first 3 months of commencing full time employment with an employer. They may also qualify if they are within the first 12 months of a part-time employment arrangement or within 3 months of completing a pre-requisite qualification. Like any traineeship, your trainee will gain on the job experience whilst completing a qualification and will receive support and feedback throughout the duration of their studies.

•An Existing Worker Traineeship is great way to upskill and develop your workforce. Through structured on the job learning, your team will deepen and broaden their workplace skills and knowledge and get a nationally recognised qualification. An Existing Worker is an employee who has already been working for you for more than three months at full time equivalent. A 'full time equivalent' could be based on part time, casual or full time work; and approved leave is included in the time calculation. Like any traineeship, your employee will gain on the job experience whilst completing a qualification and will receive support and feedback from both you and METS throughout the duration of their studies. However, unlike New Entrant Traineeships, the NSW State Government does not fund Existing Worker Traineeships and therefore we must invoice the employer, to cover the training costs. In most cases, incentives an employer will receive from the Commonwealth Government will offset these costs.
*Eligibility Criteria applies to both funding and Traineeships. More information can be found here
https://education.nsw.gov.au/skills-nsw/apprentices-and-trainees/low-cost-and-free-training-options/smart-and-skilled

For more information, visit: https://mets.edu.au/ways-to-learn/traineeships/

•School Based Traineeships (SBAT) provide Learners the opportunity to complete a Nationally Recognised Vocational Education and Training (VET) Qualification while completing their Higher School Certificate (HSC). SBATs are available to all Year 10, 11 and 12 high school students in NSW and provide the opportunity to learn and earn. Learners are supported by their employer and RTO to be flexible with their HSC curriculum.
METS offer SBAT Traineeships for
• SIR20216 Certificate II in Retail Services
• SIR30216 Certificate III in Retail
• CHC30121 Certificate III in Early Childhood Education and Care
For more information, visit: https://mets.edu.au/school-based-apprenticeships-training/

Learners that are not eligible for Traineeships can enrol into the following training options;

Self-Paced Learning
Self-Paced Learning is offered to *eligible Learners through a Fee for Service model who wish to complete the course within their own time.
They will have ongoing trainer support, without the additional requirements of a Traineeship. Depending on the industry/ qualification, trainers will still be required to complete observation tasks to deem the assessments competent
Smart and Skilled Government funding may be available. Contact the METS office for more information or click here;
For more information, visit: https://mets.edu.au/smart-and-skilled/

Skill Sets
Skills sets are designed for anyone who are wanting to upskill but not complete a full qualification course. A skill set is a single unit of competency or combination of units of competency from one or more training packages that link to a licence or regulatory requirement, or defined industry need. This generally will take a short time frame to complete the course and can save money. The learner will receive a Statement of Attainment on completion, and can Credit Transfer the units to a Full qualification if they choose to further their education.
For more information, visit: Short Courses | METS Training Services


RPL (Experience workers only)
Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL) is a process used to evaluate an individual's existing skills and knowledge to determine if they meet the criteria for a specific training course or qualification. This assessment can be based on formal, informal, or non-formal learning experiences. RPL allows individuals to leverage their past learning to gain qualifications more efficiently, saving both time and money.
Our RPL courses can be completed within 6 - 10 weeks ( hours can range from 2 - 4 hours per week dependant on qualification)
Our experienced RPL trainers work closely with learners and employers to ensure a streamlined and positive experience.
For more information, visit: https://mets.edu.au/ways-to-learn/recognition-of-prior-learning/
